docTitle.titlePart:
ALFONIC
®
TDA Ethoxylates From Iso-Tridecyl Alcohol

front.div:
Description
Sasol North America Inc.'s ALFONIC
® TDA Ethoxylates are biodegradable nonionics derived from Iso-
Tridecyl alcohol. They are essentially 100% active unless diluted with water and are ethoxylated to an
average of 3 to 15 moles of ethylene oxide.
The ALFONIC
® TDA Ethoxylates vary in physical appearance from clear or slightly hazy, colorless liquids
to white solids, depending upon the level of ethoxylation.
ALFONIC ® TDA ethoxylates with 8 or fewer moles of ethylene oxide are sparingly soluble in water, but
they are soluble in hydrocarbon solvents. The high-mole ethoxylates (greater than 8 moles ethylene
oxide) usually are soluble in polar solvents such as xylene and kerosene.
In general, an increase in the ethylene oxide chain attached to the iso-tridecyl alcohol hydrophobe
increases the HLB value (water solubility), pour point, cloud point, density, viscosity, and flash point of the
ethoxylate. Typical properties of specific ALFONIC
® TDA Ethoxylates are show in the Properties section
that follows.
ALFONIC ® TDA ethoxylates are made using NaOH ethoxylation catalyst. Narrow range, or "peaked,"
versions of these ethoxylates made from Sasol North America Inc.'s patented Novel
® II technology are
also available.
Applications
ALFONIC ® TDA Ethoxylates can be used "as is" in a wide range of applications, including:
@BULLET Emulsifiers
@BULLET Industrial and institutional cleaners
@BULLET Agricultural chemicals
@BULLET Textile and leather processing
@BULLET Metalworking systems
ALFONIC ® TDA Ethoxylates can be used as feedstocks to make alcohol ether sulfates and ether
carboxylates for use in mild shampoos and other personal care products, as well as other industrial and
agricultural applications. Alcohol ether sulfates can readily be produced from ALFONIC
® TDA ethoxylates
using SO 3 or CISO 3 H. Alcohol ether carboxylates can be produced from the ALFONIC
® TDA ethoxylates
using monochloroacetic acid.
ALFONIC ® TDA Ethoxylates can be used to make phosphate esters, which are useful as dispersants,
low-foam emulsifiers, and anti-static agents in the following applications:
